post.body: I thought he was fine-not a stand-out performance but not distracting. Didn't really think about his acting until now actually
We tried to see Benjamin Button-sold out. Saw Valkyrie instead. Not FANTASTIC but good-interesting story. Sad (of course!)
Yuck! When my suitcase has been lost I've always had it by the next morning.Hope it comes in soon & that they refund your $15.
Yay, sleep! I don't know if I'll make it to midnight--small children don't get the "sleeping in" concept even on New Year's. :(
(Yes, we got a sitter.)
We talked about getting a sitter but decided Chickie does a pretty good job taking care of Zoodle. We paid her $20 & ordered pizza.
I voted! :)
Ha!
was shocked when they first came on too. Now what's sad is, it's no loner shocking. Just sad and icky.
fun spoiling your grandson!
wondered if he would--I saw another blog post about the book and he visited it too. So I think he must search for it. Cool!
Quinoa pilaf. Glad you got in safe, but BRRRRRR!
for the update!
Tweaked my whole wheat bread recipe yesterday--added homemade oat flour with some un-ground oats, & added some wheat gluten. Nice texture!
Second night of night-weaning...only 10 minutes of crying! And slept 'til 7:30! HOORAY, ZOODLE! I finally feel well-rested today.
We are going to a MOVIE tonight for The Engineer's birthday. I don't even know when the last time is the two of us went to a theater!
I've decided I have to get Zoodle weaned off his very-early-morning feeding. That meant some crying...but when he woke up @ 7 he was fine!
Am I the only one who is just sick of watching Victoria's Secret models cavorting in their underwear on television commercials?
Made Pasta Fagioli (http://tinyurl.com/5hq766) tonight, with sausage instead of beef. Mmm. Going to bed early!
Borrowed one of my mom's vegetarian recipes for tonight. Wanted to make it more likable to The Engineer...so I added chicken. :)
